citeinfo.title: ESRI Data & Maps 2004 : U.S. National Atlas Public Land Survey

descript.abstract: U.S. National Atlas Public Land Survey represents the Public Land Surveys (for example, donation lands, land grants, private and public lands) of the United States.
descript.purpose: U.S. National Atlas Public Land Survey provides the Public Land Surveys for geographic display and analysis at regional and national levels.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

place.placekey: Virgin Islands of the United States

idinfo.useconst:
The data are provided under the Harvard University Site License. These data must be used in compliance with the Site License. This means that the data are only available for Harvard Affiliates for use on Harvard owned computers.
The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. As used herein, "Geodata" shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Public domain data from U.S. government is freely redistributable with proper metadata and source attribution.
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.
Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.
Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.
THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee.
IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.
Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.532

dataqual.logic: No duplicate features are present. The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format in ArcSDE. This verifies and validates the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from 1:500,000 and 1:1,000,000-scale state base maps for the western U.S. states and USGS topographic 1:100,000-scale maps for the eastern U.S. states. Data from both sources were integrated into the 1:2,000,000-scale State boundary Digital Line Graph (DLG) files produced by the U.S. Geological Survey. The positional accuracy of the 1:2,000,000-scale State boundary Digital Line Graph (DLG) files is known to be 1,720 meters. The positional accuracies of the other sources are unknown.

citeinfo.title: Public Land Survey System of the United States
citeinfo.othercit: The data set was downloaded from the web site in August 2002.

procstep.procdesc:
Public Land Survey System data were collected from 1:500,000 and 1:1,000,000 State base maps for the western United States. The eastern States were collected from existing 1:100,000-scale USGS topographic sheets base maps. Data from both sources were integrated into 1:2,000,000 State-level DLG files, then generalized and vertically integrated with 1:2,000,000-scale Digital Line Graph Data - Boundaries, County Boundaries of the United States, and Hydrography Features of the United States. The resulting Public Land Survey System DLG files were published on CD-ROM in 1995. The DLG optional-format files were then converted to Arc/INFO coverages, and the individual State files were paneled together into a national coverage. Numeric DLG codes were translated into English, non-polygon features were deleted, and the data set was converted to shapefile format.
Township and Range values were corrected in the Boise, Copper River, Fifth Principal, Fourth Principal, Sixth Principal, Indian, Louisiana, Salt Lake, St. Stephens, Third Principal, Umiat, and Willamette surveys. In all, 250 corrections were made using 1:100,000-scale USGS topographic sheets base maps. Some polygons in coastal areas were added or deleted to accurately portray the extent of a Township or unsurveyed area.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile compressed file, plss00p020.tar.gz, from http://www.nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html and extracted it. Removed unneeded attributes. Removed all features where values of the FEATURE1 attribute were "Water". Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added attribute TWNRNG and calculated its values from abbreviating the values of FEATURE2. Added SQMI attribute and calculated its values.

procstep.procdesc: This layer was originally downloaded from the ESRI Data and Maps 2004 DVD. The file was stored in an SDC (Smart Data Compression) format on the DVD. ArcCatalog 9.1 was utilized to export the SDC file into an ArcSDE 9.1 database using the "Feature Class to Feature Class" export tool

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the Public Land Survey which is a rectangular system of surveys devised to subdivide public domain lands within United States; in addition are donation land claims, Indian lands, land grants, civil colonies, military reservations, overlapping land grants, private surveys, unsurveyed areas, and areas not part of the Public Land Survey System within United States.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area that was allocated to a settler under the Donation Act of September 27, 1850 to preserve the rights of pre-statehood settlers claimed prior to the regular division of townships and ranges.
Land granted to native Americans and excluded from the public domain.
An area of land to which title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States.
A military or lighthouse reservation that limits the public lands.

edom.edomv: Not Part of Public Land Surveys System
edom.edomvd: An area that is outside of the Public Land Survey System.

An area of land to which more than one title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States. These areas are the result of survey error or disputed claims.
An area of private surveys of public domain lands.

An area of land subdivided by the Public Land Survey System (PLSS), which was originally created on public domain lands and the rules for its use were defined by the authority of the U.S. Government. The PLSS has since been extended, following similar rules, into non- public domain areas.
An area that is part of the public domain but which has not been subdivided.

attr.attrdef: The township and range designation for the area.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: There is no predefined set of valid township and range designations. Designations are in the format "Township xx aaaaa Range yyy bbbb", where xx and yyy are numbers, aaaaa is either North or South, and bbbb is either East or West.

attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area of land to which title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States.

An area of land to which more than one title was conferred by a predecessor government and confirmed by the U.S. Government after the territory in which it is situated was acquired by the United States. These areas are the result of survey error or disputed claims.

attr.attrdef: The primary name of the survey area. This is the principal meridian, Ohio base, or land grant name.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The secondary name of the survey area. This is an additional land grant name.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The tertiary name of the survey area. This is an additional land grant name.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for each state in which the survey area is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The abbreviated township and range designation for the area.

attrdomv.udom: Designations are in the format "Txxa Ryyyb", where xx and yyy are numbers, a is either N or S, and b is either E or W.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in square coverage units
Length of arc in coverage units
The area of the survey area in square miles.
